title: Difference between Nominal and Real GDP

content.question: Which of the following describes a difference between nominal gross domestic product <math alttext="open parenthesis, G D P, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>GDP</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> uses constant prices to measure the value of final output, while real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> uses current prices.

Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> uses current prices to measure the value of final output, while real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> uses constant prices.

Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> measures how much output is produced within the borders of a country, while real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> measures how much output is produced around the world by domestic companies.

Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> includes sales of used goods while real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does not.

Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> takes into account the size of the population while real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> does not.

content.answer: Nominal <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> uses current prices to measure the value of final output, while real <math alttext="G D P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> uses constant prices.
